data.title: TOYOTA MOTOR CORPORATION GLOBAL WEBSITE
data.meta_description: Various materials concerning Toyota Motor Corporations' automotive business
data.text:
Year

Month

Technology developed and applied

Applicable Vehicle

1947

Four-wheel independent suspension installed

SA compact passenger car

1955

Wishbone front suspension installed

Crown

1958

Ball joint suspension installed

Crown

1966

MacPherson strut front suspension installed

Corolla

1967

Radial tires, four-wheel double-wishbone suspension, magnesium disk wheels, four-wheel disk brakes, tilt steering wheel, and rack-and-pinion steering system employed

2000GT

Energy-absorbing steering column installed

Crown

Integral hydraulic power-steering system installed

Century

1971

Electronically controlled anti-skid brakes installed

Crown

1974

Drum-in-disk, four-wheel disk brakes installed

Crown

Speed-sensitive power steering installed

Crown

1976

Rear semi-trailing independent suspension installed

Mark II

1983

Toyota Electronically Modulated Suspension (TEMS) installed (a world first)

Soarer

Four-wheel electronic anti-skid control and progressive power steering installed

Crown

1984

November

Three-link front suspension with leading arms installed on SUVs

Land Cruiser

1985

Microcomputer-controlled tilt and telescopic steering wheel/system installed

Crown

1986

January

Electronically controlled full air suspension (spring constant, variable attenuation force) installed (a world first)

Soarer

January

Cast aluminum upper arm developed (a world first for mass-produced cars)

Soarer

Hydraulic-reaction-force, electronically controlled power steering installed

Mark II

1987

September

Traction Control (TRC), the first traction-control system by a Japanese manufacturer, employed

Crown

September

Motorized tilt/telescoping steering column installed (a Toyota first)

Crown

December

Subframe-mounted strut suspension installed

Corona

1988

Airbags installed (a Toyota first)

Crown

1989

May

Four-link suspension with lateral rod installed as rear suspension on SUVs

Hilux Surf

September

High-mount upper arm and double wishbone suspension installed

Lexus LS400, Celsior

September

Toyota Active Control Suspension (the first such suspension in the world) installed

Celica

September

Dual-mode four-wheel steering installed

Celica

October

High-performance twin-tube shock absorber developed (a world first)

First-generation Celsior

October

Piezo TEMS (Toyota electronic modulated suspension) developed (a world first)

Celsior

Electro Hydraulic Power Steering (EHPS) installed (a Toyota first)

MR2

1990

May

Chassis control technology receives the Technical Development Award from the Society of Automotive Engineers of Japan,. Later, the technology won the Medal for New Technology from the Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers.

May

Double wishbone rear suspension installed on minivans

Estima

1991

Super Strut Suspension developed

Corolla

May

Full-active suspension and active rear steering comprehensive system developed (a world first)

Soarer

1992

October

i-Four comprehensive vehicle control system developed

Crown Majesta

1994

October

Toyota's first mass-produced gated automatic transmission shifter employed with the Celsior shift control system

Celsior

October

Sky-hook air suspension employed

Celsior

1995

August

Vehicle Stability Control (VSC) system employed

Crown Majesta

1996

Automatic transmission column shift lever, with a passenger-car feel, developed

Noah

May

Coupled torsion-beam rear suspension installed

Ipsum

1997

August

Active Rear Steer (ARS) system installed

Aristo (turbo version)

May

Brake Assist offered as standard

Raum

October

Pinion-type Electric Power Steering (EPS) adopted

Prius

October

Coupled beam suspension with toe control link (inter-beam) developed

Prius

October

World's first regenerative braking system developed

Prius

1998

January

Suspension system combining Active Height Control (AHC) and Skyhook TEMS newly developed (a world first)

Land Cruiser 100

January

Variable brake-pedal ratio and small-bore, long-stroke master cylinder employed

Land Cruiser

1999

August

Antilock brake system with Electronic Brake-force Distribution (EBD) developed

Land Cruiser Prado, Fun Cargo, Celica

September

Electronically controlled air suspension combining nonlinear H-infinity control of damping force and roll-orientation control developed

Crown

2000

Forged-aluminum, high-mount knuckle developed

Celsior

Column-type electric power steering (brushed motor) adopted

Corolla

2001

January

First run-flat tires for a mass-production vehicle in the company's lineup employed

Soarer, Lexus SC 430

May

L-shaped lower arm made from 780 MPa-class high tensile strength steel developed

Ipsum

May

Full regenerative braking system using a brake-by-wire system (ECB) installed

Estima Hybrid

2002

August

Variable Gear Ratio Steering (VGRS) installed

Land Cruiser 100

August

Quiet Vehicle Stability Control (VSC) system with gear pump adopted

Celica, Caldina, MR2

2003

January

Supplemental brake-force distribution and antilock brake system added to Vehicle Stability Control (VSC) system

Yaris

August

High-performance monotube shock absorber employed. Exclusive designs for all structural components implemented by focusing on axial force characteristics in minute amplitude area, attenuation force characteristics with no delay from input, and smooth axial force characteristics.

Celsior

November

Mass production of the Kinetic Dynamic Suspension System (KDSS) starts (the first mass production of such a suspension system in the world)

Lexus GX 470

Automatic transmission shift-by-wire gearshift employed (a Toyota mass-production first)

Prius

September

Steering-assisted Vehicle Stability Control (S-VSC), which harmoniously controls VSC and electronic power steering, employed

Prius

December

Five-link multilink suspension installed

Crown

December

Rack coaxial electronically controlled power steering installed (a Toyota first)

Crown

2004

July

Vehicle Dynamics Integrated Management (VDIM) first employed

Crown Majesta

2005

February

Pipe torsion beam developed

Vitz

August

VDIM integrated with active steering control employed (the first mass production of such an integrated system in the world)

Lexus GS 430

August

Electronically controlled, active stabilizer suspension system employed (a world first). Later, the technology won the Medal for New Technology from the Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers.

Lexus GS 430

November

Core-based, run-flat tires (a world first for mass-production vehicles) offered as option

RAV4 (European models)

November

Trailing-arm wishbone suspension installed

RAV4

November

Column-type electric power steering (brushless motor) adopted

RAV4

Variable volume pump employed with hydraulic power steering (a Toyota first)

Century

2006

Pre-collision System featuring a vehicle-front pedestrian detection system and collision-avoidance steering support

Double-joint, multi-link front suspension developed

2007

September

Improved KDSS developed

Land Cruiser
